string.text:
Blind dogs are the most familiar representative of the Zone.
 
Several generations of dogs have lived and died since the second disaster, with each being more affected by the Zone than the previous.
 
Numerous rapid mutations and evolutionary adaptations have led to the strengthening of previously weakly expressed canine abilities - primarily at the expense of those that also share their habitat.
 
Vision and hearing in many of these dogs is completely lost, but they have since developed a kind of telepathic vision that allows them to feel their prey literally through the walls.
 
Like their wild ancestors - the wolves - blind dogs hunt in packs, and an encounter with a large group can be dangerous even to the most well-armed and experienced of stalkers.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Low
• Speed: Fast
• Abilities: None

Bloodsuckers, as the name would suggest, are hematophagous monsters.
 
The bloodsucker is semi-legendary creature, often seen by stalkers as a symbol of both the dangers and corruption of the Zone.
 
This status has been achieved thanks to the species' relative rarity and the low survival rate of its victims.
 
Perhaps their most peculiar ability is their optic camouflage, which allows them to temporarily become almost invisible to the naked eye.
 
Typically this won't last long, as they are at their weakest when cloaked and will often only use it when discovering prey or trying to hide their movements.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Average
• Speed: Fast
• Abilities: Camouflage, Blood-sucking

Boars are a common mutant found in the Zone.
 
While less touched by mutation physically, the boars here have developed serious taste for human flesh and much sharper intelligence.
 
They are large animals, and their ability to survive and their aggression surpasses all of their living relatives outsize of the Zone.
 
Mutagenic processes have played a significant part in shaping these mammals: they have lost all fur in a few places and grown long, bristly fur in others.
 
Usually if distance is kept and they aren't antagonised, they will stick with their herd of other boars and flesh.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Average
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: None

Burers are stocky, almost dwarf-like monsters that usually stick to underground areas.
 
They are humanoid creatures of hypertrophied complexion, clad in shreds of shabby overalls and generally afraid of bright lights.
 
Created as the result of genetic experiments on criminals under the program of human telekinetic development, burers naturally posses powerful telekinetic abilities.
 
Being able to direct blasts of energy and manipulate physical objects with their mind, fighting burers can be a difficult foe even when trying to hide from them.
 
• Attacks: Psychic (Electrical, Psi, Thermal)
• Health: High
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: Psi-powers, Telekinesis

Cats in the Zone are heavily mutated from local wildcats.
 
Originally ordinary pets, under the influence of the Zone they have changed quite remarkably, becoming very dangerous even to people.
 
In most cases cats will live alone in a small group of two to three individuals, and will typically dwell in quiet, secluded places such as forest thickets.
 
Often when they attack, the first will try to distract their prey whilst the rest sneak behind and try to slash and bite, until it tires and/or bleeds out.
 
If on their own they will instead behave quite cowardly, spending a long time stalking their target and harassing them until finding a good opportunity to attack.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Average
• Speed: Fast
• Abilities: None

Chimeras are hairless monsters, close to the size of an adult lion.
 
An almost evolutionarily perfect killing machine, though not physically the strongest, they account for this through extreme speed and aggressiveness.
 
With a duplicate set of organs, no central circulatory system, and its whole body permeated with capillaries, the chimera can easily shrug off organ failure and massive blood loss.
 
Its second head allows for an even wider field of view, its hind legs allow it to jump huge distances, and its razor sharp claws and teeth can tear through practically any body armour.
 
They are nocturnal creatures, so usually you won't see many of them during the day as they will be resting, but that doesn't rule it out as a possibility.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Average
• Speed: Fast
• Abilities: Regeneration, Distant leaps

Controllers are some of the most dangerous psychic mutants in the Zone.
 
Outwardly resembling a human being with a disproportionately enlarged head, a controller is capable of influencing and often directly controlling another living being's actions.
 
Unlike other psychic mutants a controller won't manipulate physical objects, but will instead fight with its brain - in a very literal sense - often taking its enemies through surprise and confusion.
 
The controller attacks mainly with a directed psi-bolt, which causes severe damage to the brain of its recipient, whilst passive exposure to the mutant can ultimately lead to suicide or zombification.
 
It is widely believed that they can only attack what they can see, so making good use of cover to conceal yourself from its view could make all the difference in the outcome of fighting this creature.
 
• Attacks: Melee, Psychic
• Health: Average
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: Passive damage, Psi-powers, Mind control

Crows are the only bird species to have survived in the Zone.
 
In order not to perish in a labyrinth of gravitational anomalies, military pilots use sophisticated detectors, but the secret of how crows safely navigate the Zone's skies remains a mystery.
 
Little else known about what makes the Zone's crows so special, or why they have remained almost completely genetically intact when compared to the rest of the local wildlife.
 
• Attacks: None
• Health: Low
• Speed: Fast
• Abilities: None

Flesh are heavily mutated pigs, but one of the most harmless mutants of the Zone.
 
Like many other living creatures, domestic pigs in the Zone underwent serious mutations following the second disaster, affecting genes responsible for their metabolism.
 
This eventually caused the animal's phenotype to change significantly, their forelimbs have turned into insect-like legs which the flesh uses for digging up roots and tearing down carrion, whilst their bodies have become extremely bloated and fatty.
 
However they are mostly harmless, and will generally flee from a stalker if one approaches unless the creature is attacked or cornered and has nowhere else to run.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Low
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: None

Fractures are former - seemingly devolved - human beings with an animalistic mindset.
 
Unlike other mutant humanoids the fracture has retained a rather familiar appearance, looking like a hunchbacked old man in tattered clothing, despite being over two meters tall.
 
Not much is known about these creatures, it is believed they were either former residents who illegally lived in the area before the second disaster, or early test subjects involved in genetic experimentation.
 
Its hypertrophied arms and swollen hands slow the creature down, but also act like clubs which are able to easily knock down grown men with very little effort.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: Average
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: None

Karliks are very rare dwarf-like mutants which hide away in seclusion.
 
As if having the ultimate case of short man syndrome, what a karlik lacks in height it makes up for tenfold with its psychic abilities.
 
It is unclear whether or not they are related to burers, but between them they share a great many similarities making it difficult to dismiss as just coincidence - for example all abilities of the burer are also shared by the karlik.
 
On the few rare occasions that observations have been made, karliks are seen captivated by certain locations or artefacts as if they have tasked themselves with their responsibility - attacking and killing everything that comes too close.
 
Hardly anything else is known about them, as most who have encountered the creatures directly are often found dead or crazy with no discernible physical injuries.
 
• Attacks: Psychic (Electrical, Psi, Thermal)
• Health: High
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: Passive damage, Phantom projection, Psi-powers, Telekinesis

Pseudogiants are one of the rarest and most fearsome mutants in the Zone.
 
Unlike other humanoid mutants, the pseudogiant has developed incredible strength and can withstand an inhuman amount of punishment before succumbing to its wounds and dying.
 
A pair of disproportionately huge limbs and incredibly powerful physical attacks allows it to devastate anything that is unfortunate enough to get near it. Being able to create shockwaves that hurl objects by simply slamming its huge feet.
 
Despite their resilience they appear to be more territorial than offensive, typically not pursuing a target more than a short distance before abandoning the chase and falling back, only attacking when another target gets within range.
 
The pseudogiant also may retreat from a battle after having lost only about half or even a fourth of its health, such events bring into question the nature of the creature, as it's not as relentless and persistent as more predatory mutants despite its strength.
 
• Attacks: Melee
• Health: High
• Speed: Slow
• Abilities: Immense strength
